meanings.def: a person who is in charge of running a business, a shop or a similar organization or part of one
examples: The company always needs project managers.
I'm a senior manager in a multinational company.
If you have any questions, speak to your manager.
He has been promoted to business development manager.
It helps to have a sympathetic manager.
Last month she was named manager of the new unit.
They hired a new campaign manager.
Your job will be to assist the production manager.

meanings.def: a person who deals with the business affairs of an actor, a musician, etc.
examples: The comedian is unavailable for comment, according to her manager.
The band's manager said that the gig sold out in hours.

meanings.def: a person who trains and organizes a sports team
examples: He will be the club's caretaker manager until a new manager is appointed.

meanings.def: a person who is good at managing resources
examples: She's a good manager who never throws any food away.
TV ads depicted the candidate as a would-be efficient manager of the US economy.
